result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Michael Lambert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 4:00 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF743, 14CF914, AND 14CF915. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty Amanda Ley.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to file amended information in 14CF915. COURT grants. 

State moves to: 
In 14CF743: Ct. 1 (False Imprisonment/DA)>>AMEND to DC/DA pursuant to 947.01(1) with charging language of unreasonably loud conduct. 
In 14CF914: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF915: Ct. 4 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Entry Into a Locked Dwelling)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Misd. Theft)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF743: Amended Ct. 1 (DC/DA)>>GUILTY. 
In 14CF915: Ct. 1 (Misd. Take and Drive Vehicle without consent - joyriding)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 7 (DC/DA)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, def guilty, and defers entry of judgment on Cts. 2 & 3 in 14CF915. 

COURT ORDERS: In 14CF915: On Cts. 2 and 3>>DEOJ for 3 with conditions as outlined in written agreement. 
                           : On remaining 3 misd. counts>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: SAFE program; co-parenting class if available; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week; no contact with K.K. and E.A. unless approved by agent; no possession of any dangerous weapons; restitution of $102.59 to E.A; court costs including 2 DA surcharges. 
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 42 days jail credit on all if revoked. 
Atty Ley requests bond be amended to signature bond. 
COURT modifies bond to $30,000 signature bond with same conditions except no contact provision is removed. 
COURT notes $3000 cash bond to be used toward payment of court costs. 
Review of DEOJ set for 4/12/2018 at 1:10 pm with Br. 2 JA. 
Adj: 4:15 pm

Request For Adjournment of plea hearing on 3/30/15 - granted
Includes 14CF743, 14CF914, 14CF915
Plea hearing on March 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 30, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

AMENDED: $30,000.00 signature bond with first $3,000.00 in cash TO BE CO-SIGNED BY DEFENDANT'S FATHER.  BOND INCLUDES 14CF743, 14CF914, 14CF915.    Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.  No contact with victim(s): (NON WAIVABLE); K.K.; E.A. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  EMPD escort to retrieve any personal belongings.  A.L. is designated person where children may be dropped off & picked up, to be arranged so victim is not present and Family Resource Center to provide arrangements for exchanges if A.L. is not available.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 2:35 p.m. 
**Includes 14CF743, 14CF914 & 14CF915**
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in person with Atty Amanda Ley. 
Date & time set for motion to modify bond. Atty Ley is requesting bond modification for contact with defendant's 2 minor children. State objects to bond modification but notes victim is in agreement with allowing contact with children. 
COURT ORDERS: Bond be modified with the following conditions: Ashley Lambert is designated person where children may be dropped off & picked up, to be arranged so victim is not present, and Family Resource Center to provide arrangements for exchanges if Ashley is not available. All other conditions to remain in effect. 
Future dates to be set with JA.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond - includes 14CF743, 14CF914, 14CF915
to Modify Bond Conditions

$30,000.00 CASH BOND APPLIES IF: DEFENDANT IS NOT ALLOWED IN THE DEPARTMENT'S GPS/EMP PROGRAM.  If Defendant can come to an agreement with the Sheriff's Department to be released on the Department's GPS/EMP Program, THEN the $1,000.00 cash bond applies.  If such an agreement is arrived at, the Defendant must be in full compliance with all rules, terms and conditions of the program.  BOND INCLUDES 14CF743, 14CF914, 14CF915.    Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.  No contact with victim(s): C.K. (NON WAIVABLE); K.K.; E.A.; A.G.I.; T.J.L. (minors)(NON WAIVABLE); H.E.L.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  EMPD escort to retrieve any personal belongings.  3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.  If not allowed in the Program, Defendant must post $30,000 cash to be released.

Clerk Deanna.
Case Called:  3:52 pm
Includes cases 14CF743, 14CF914 and 14CF915.
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person/in custody w/Atty Amanda Ley.
Motion regarding Bond.
COURT:    Bond is set in the amount of $30,000 cash.  However, I will allow the Deft to be released on a $1,000 cash bond if he/she can come to an agreement with the Sheriff's Department to be released on the Department's GPS/EMP Program.  If such an agreement is arrived at the Deft must be in full compliance with all rules, terms and conditions of the program the origianl conditions of bond will remain.  No contact with KK, EA, HEL, TJL.  If not allowed in the the Program, Deft must post $30,000 cash to be released.
